customer_reviews.title: Very nice hard shell jacket
customer_reviews.text: This is my first truly waterproof jacket and it is a winner. The fit and finish are very good. Some reviews have stated that the arms are a bit long, but I believe that is a plus. Yes, you do have to use the hook and loop straps to cinch it around your wrists, but the extra length lets you reach up over your head without exposing your lower forearms. I've been through several weeks of rain in this jacket and it has done its job every time. If you are patient, you can get it for around 3 bills.

customer_reviews.title: Love this Jacket

customer_reviews.title: Excellent hard shell
customer_reviews.text: This is an outstanding Arc'teryx jacket. I had an Arc'teryx jacket stolen from my luggage on the way to Buenos Aires, and I bought this one as a replacement. It is by far the best Gortex jacket I have ever owned, and I have owned a number of them. When they call it a hard shell, there is a reason. The material is a bit stiff and is a little noisy when you move about. You may not sneak up on game in the woods when wearing it, but you will be dry.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful. Every detail is thought of and it feels ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful. Every detail is thought of and it feels like a high end, professional piece of gear. I fully trust it will do its job when I'm out in the elements. One thing to remember: it's only an outer shell. You will want an insulating layer, such as a down or wool jacket, underneath this for really cold weather.
customer_reviews.author: visualcondition

customer_reviews.title: Shell Jacket
customer_reviews.text: Fits very well by your normal size (loose by size intentionally so you can wear something underneath it.) I bought this shell coat and an Arc'teryx down coat for my main layer, wore them to a very cold Packers game two weeks ago and wasn't cold at all. You don't feel the wind or rain either. It's a great jacket. My only complaint would be the pockets aren't that large of you're wearing thick gloves. I can see where they could potentially fall out. Overall I'd buy it again though.

product_meta.title: Arc'teryx Men's Beta AR Jacket
product_meta.description: A packable, waterproof Arc'Teryx jacket crafted in GORE-TEX ripstop. An internal drawstring details the hip-length hem, and the billed hood is capable of concealing a helmet. Zips at the placket, 2 front pockets, and underarm vents.
feature_bullets: BETA AR JACKET - The streamlined Beta AR Jacket provides the backcountry minimalist with durable storm protection in a lightweight and packable format. This hip length GORE-TEX Pro jacket reduces layering overlap and bulk, a helmet compatible DropHood offers quick storm protection, and reinforced shoulder and elbows survive alpine abuse.

ALL AROUND - A mainstay in the Arc'teryx lineup since 2000, the Beta AR is the do everything, most versatile waterproof / breathable jacket for mountain environments. Hand pockets, athletic fit that accommodates layers and a hood with an internal collar mean comfort in storms, climbing, skiing or simply enjoying the outdoors.

JUST THE RIGHT LENGTH - Hip length is the easiest to work with when layering waterproof / breathable garments. Not too short so it doesn't ride up or expose the lower back and not so long as to be cumbersome underneath a harness or a pack belt, the Beta AR hits the middle ground.

THE HOOD - A good hood is a crucial detail on any serious alpine jacket. The Beta AR features the Arc'teryx DropHood, a helmet-compatible, fast adjust hood with a separate collar for draft protection.

THE KEY PIECE - The Beta AR is a solid, well-rounded piece. Durable, lightweight, with hand pockets and pit zippers for ventilation, it can manage storms, rock, snow and cool seasons. GORE-TEX Pro delivers the highest level of waterproof / breathable performance.
